title: Bride and Prejudice's Jojo reveals her battle with bulimia
text:
Bride and Prejudice's Jojo has opened up about her battle with bulimia and anorexia.

The 38-year-old has battled an eating disorder on-and-off since childhood.

Speaking to New Idea magazine, Jojo said that it started with the death of her twin sister when she was just six-years-old.

Struggles: Bride and Prejudice's Jojo has opened up about her battle with bulimia and anorexia

'I guess subconsciously as a child you really take it on board and I turned to food, not even knowing it, to deal with my emotions she said.

After gaining weight from overeating, Jojo started to control her food intake once she hit high school.

'Controlling my diet was my way of controlling things in my life,' she explained.

Couple: Jojo is currently starring on Channel Seven's Bride and Prejudice with her partner Jess

I guess it turned more to anorexia in the early stages then it evolved to bulimia from there.'

Jojo, who is in a same-sex relationship with her partner Jess, is at odds with her strict Lebanese Catholic parents on this season of Bride and Prejudice.

Her parents, Sid and Lody, don't approve of her marrying another woman and are refusing to attend her wedding to Jess.

Parents: Jojo, who is in a same-sex relationship with her partner Jess, is at odds with her strict Lebanese Catholic parents on this season of Bride and Prejudice

On Monday's episode of the show, Lody said that Jojo's deceased twin sister was in a 'better place' than Jojo is right now, because of Jojo's sexuality.

During a tense sit down with Lody, Jojo said: 'I think I struggled with my self-identity since I lost my sister.'

'Your sister is in a much better place than where you are now,' Lody shot back.

Bride and Prejudice continues on Channel Seven at 7:30pm Tuesday and Wednesday.
description: Bride and Prejudice's Jojo has opened up about her battle with bulimia and anorexia.
